intro: Lupinus tooelensis, commonly known as the Tooel lupine, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its tall, erect growth habit and clusters of pea-like flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. Lupinus tooelensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and open habitats. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is of interest for its potential in ecological restoration projects.
